meanings.sent1: I need to rewind the tape to hear the song again.
meanings.sent2: Can you rewind the video to the beginning?
meanings.sent3: I tried to rewind time to fix my mistake, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: Sometimes I wish I could rewind life like a movie and make different choices.
meanings.sent5: The ability to rewind memories would be a valuable superpower.

meanings.definition: To reverse the winding of a tape or film
meanings.sent1: After watching the movie, remember to rewind the VHS tape.
meanings.sent2: Don't forget to rewind the cassette tape before returning it.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally hit fast forward instead of rewind on the tape player.
meanings.sent4: The film reel seemed to rewind itself magically, playing in reverse.
meanings.sent5: The old camera required manual effort to rewind the film after each shot.

meanings.definition: To go back in time or reverse a process
meanings.sent1: If only we could rewind to the days of carefree childhood.
meanings.sent2: Is there a way to rewind the effects of climate change?
meanings.sent3: Trying to rewind a broken vase back to its original state is impossible.
meanings.sent4: She wished she could rewind the argument and choose her words more carefully.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's experiment aimed to rewind the aging process in cells.
